articles.title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
articles.description:
The flags are one of Logan’s most enduring, yet inconspicuous, tributes to the Sept. 11, 2001, terror attacks.

The post Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Logan Airport displays American flags above gates B32 and C19 as a tribute to 9/11.
The flags serve as a reminder of the September 11, 2001, terror attacks.
Boston residents can reflect on the significance of these tributes while traveling.

articles.title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
articles.description:
Healey's approval ratings are also much higher than Trump's and RFK Jr.'s among Mass. voters.

The post MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: MassINC poll shows 52% of Massachusetts voters approve of Governor Healey's performance.
Healey's approval ratings surpass those of Trump and RFK Jr. among local voters.
Higher approval may influence Healey's policies and initiatives affecting Boston residents.

Your guide to discounts around Greater Boston with a valid student ID.

summary: Discover over 50 local businesses offering discounts for college students in Greater Boston.

articles.title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
articles.description:

summary: Rep. Lori Trahan expresses concern over Arthur T. Demoulas's firing from Market Basket.

articles.title: What Jabrill Peppers said about his surprising release from the Patriots
articles.description:
"You play a long time in this league, you know, you're going to get traded or cut."

summary: Jabrill Peppers was released by the New England Patriots on September 11, 2025.
Peppers acknowledged the unpredictability of NFL careers, highlighting trade and cut risks.
His release may impact the Patriots' defensive strategy and local fan expectations.

articles.title: What’s the deal with this art installation near South Station made entirely of coolers?
articles.description:
The gold pyramid of coolers makes a statement about street vendors and, if you look closely, about ICE.

The post What’s the deal with this art installation near South Station made entirely of coolers? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Art installation near South Station features a gold pyramid made of coolers.
Installation highlights street vendors' significance and runs until September 2025.
Local artists aim to raise awareness about the role of ice in urban culture.
